div.p: The GDSL Editor allows you to:

li.span: Validate GDSL Code for Proper Form
Encode GDSL Code for Keyhole Markup Language (KML) Transmittal

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: GDSL is a simple scripting language consisting of:

ul.li: Assignment (=), comparison (>=, etc.) and mathematical (+, -, etc.) operators
Data layer names. These are server-side image and data files (e.g. LandCover, ContinentalUSElevation)

div.p: The screenshot above represents a combination of two different types of datasets (elevation and image) combined and evaluated using GDSL to form the output image sent to the client.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: How to write valid GDSL code
While GDSL is a simple scripting language, it gives users a lot of flexibility with authored image and data files. There are rules to writing valid GDSL code, however:

ul.li: If and Else are the only branching/conditional statements.
There is no iteration or recursion as there are no 'for' or 'while' loops.
All variables are global in scope.
Braces must be used for any statements/expressions longer than one line.

div.p: Once you have entered GDSL code into the Editor, you click Validate to make sure it is well-formed and valid. If it is valid then the button's color will change to green and if not, the button's color will be red.

h1.span: Encode GDSL Code for KML Transmittal

div.p: How to encode GDSL into a format for transmittal by http
div.div:
Upon successful validation of the code:
Click Encode, and if no error occurs, then the button's background color will change to green. This encodes the GDSL into a format that be transported via HTTP and KML.
Click Save Encoding to copy the encoded GDSL to memory and then paste it into the Capabilities.kml file on the GDS server.
